member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets color of border, grid lines, and text within zoom window. ZoomWindowCustomColors must be True to enable this setting. ///

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets color of background within zoom window. ZoomWindowCustomColors must be True to enable this setting. ///

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.GradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of zoom window gradient. Zoom Window gradients are enabled only if ZoomWindowCustomColors is True, PeColor.BitmapGradientMode is True, and ZoomWindowBackColor = Empty.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.GradientStart
member.summary: Gets or sets start color of background gradient within zoom window. ZoomWindowCustomColors must be True and GradientStyle non zero to enable this setting. ///

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.GradientEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets end color of background gradient within zoom window. ZoomWindowCustomColors must be True and GradientStyle non zero to enable this setting. ///

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.BmpStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of zoom window gradient. Zoom Window gradients are enabled only if ZoomWindowCustomColors is True, PeColor.BitmapGradientMode is True, and ZoomWindowBackColor = Empty.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.BmpFilename
member.summary: Gets or Sets filename used for the zoom window background bitmap. Bitmaps are enabled only if PeColor.BitmapGradientMode is True, ZoomWindow.CustomColors is True, ZoomWindow.BackColor = Empty, and ZoomWindow.BmpStyle is non-zero.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets and Sets the Image used as background image for zoom window area. This property is only enabled if PeColor.BitmapGradientMode is True, ZoomWindow.BackColor = Empty, and ZoomWindow.BmpStyle is non-zero. This property or ZoomWindow.BmpFilename can be used to assign a bitmap. If both are assigned, this property takes precedence.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.DataHotSpots
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether the zoom window will include data hot spots.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.ShowAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether annotations show within the zoom window.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.DataShadows
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether data shadows draw behind plotting methods within the zoom window.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.MarkDataPoints
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether data points are highlighed with a dot within the zoom window.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.InExports
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether zoom window is drawn in exported images or during printing.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.ShadowLevel
member.summary: Gets and Sets the zoom window shadow depth that denotes the active charting view. Default=100. Range 0 to 255. Larger numbers darken shadow. Only enabled when RenderEngine=GdiPlus.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.Border
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of zoom window border. Default is BorderType where if any type of border exist for chart, a thin line will surround zoom window. Border=force line border. NoBorder=never show a border. Uses Enums.ZoomWindowBorder

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ZoomWindowPlotItems.Showing
member.summary: Read only, gets whether zoom window is currently shown.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.OptionsPlotItems.SymbolFrequency
member.summary: Gets or Sets the frequency of symbols placed into plotting methods when Color.ViewingStyle = MonoWithSymbols.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.OptionsPlotItems.FixedLineThickness
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether line thickness is independent of image size. This property works with solid line types produced when Plot.Method is set to Line.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.OptionsPlotItems.Clipping
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether plotting method graphic commands are clipped to within the axis in which they reside. Set this property to False to disable clipping. Manually scaling and zooming can both cause plotting graphics to extend outside its axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.OptionsPlotItems.TriangleAnnotationAdj
member.summary: This property controls how triangle data symbols are located. If True, triangles are located so their vertex is at the y data value. This allows up-triangle and down-triangle symbols to work as pointers and point to the location defined by the y data value. If False, symbols are centered at the y data location.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.OptionsPlotItems.PointColorLineAdj
member.summary: Gets and Sets how PeColor.PointColors colors individual line segments. Set to True to have lines colored leading up to the data point, else, the line segmnet is colored following the data point.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SubsetGradientStyle
member.summary: Gets and Sets per subset gradient style. Set to items included within ProEssentials.Enums.PlotGradientStyle.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SubsetGradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets and Sets per subset gradient style boundary. Set to items included within ProEssentials.Enums.GradientBoundary.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaBevelStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel style for area plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaGradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the gradient style for area plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaStackedBevelStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel style for area stacked plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaStackedGradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the gradient style for area stacked plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BarBevelStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel style for bar plotting methods. Set with Enums.BevelStyle

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BarGradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the gradient style for bar plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SplineBevelStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel style for spline plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SplineGradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the gradient style for spline plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SpecificPlotModeGradient
member.summary: Gets or Sets the gradient style for candlestick and high-low bar plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaGradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets or Sets the boundary of gradient for area plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaStackedGradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets or Sets the boundary of gradient for area stacked plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BarGradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets or Sets the boundary of gradient for bar plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SplineGradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets or Sets the boundary of gradient for spline plotting methods.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaBevelLighting
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel lighting style for area plotting methods if AreaBevelStyle is non zero.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AreaStackedBevelLighting
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel lighting style for area stacked plotting methods if AreaStackedBevelStyle is non zero.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BarBevelLighting
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel lighting style for bar plotting methods if BarBevelStyle is non zero.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SplineBevelLighting
member.summary: Gets or Sets the bevel lighting style for spline plotting methods if SplineBevelStyle is non zero.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BevelLimit
member.summary: Related to area, bar, spline bevels, defines the lower threshold where bevel is no longer drawn if attempted width is less than defined, default = 3 pixels

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SpecificPlotModeBorder
member.summary: Default 4 pixels, with no gradient, if candle/high-low-bar is greater than this width, a border is drawn on candle portion.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BarGlassEffect
member.summary: Set true for bars to have an additional glass effect.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.AdjoinBars
member.summary: Set True to force bar charts to draw bars with no gaps between bars. We mostly added this feature to draw colormap type charts. Colormaps can be built with a stacked bar chart with many subsets, points and AdjoinBars = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BestFitCoeffs
member.summary: Read only, Gets best fit coefficients when Plot.Method is set to PointsPlusBestFitLine or PointsPlusBestFitCurve. The degree of the coefficients are also controlled by Plot.Option.BestFitDegree or Plot.Option.SubsetDegree. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SubsetDegree
member.summary: Gets and Sets best fit degree per subset index. Set with ProEssentials.Enums.BestFitDegree. See also Plot.Option.BestFitDegree.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.TreatCompsAsNormal
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether comparison subsets are plotted via Plot.Method or Plot.ComparisonMethod.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.NegativeFromXAxis
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether negative Bar, Area, and Stick plotting method graphics get drawn from the x axis or from bottom of chart.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BestFitDegree
member.summary: Gets or Sets the best fit degree when Plot.Method is set to PointsPlusBestFitCurve. See also SubsetDegree.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.CurveGranularity
member.summary: Gets or Sets the curve granularity for plotting methods that interpolate between data points.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.LineGapThreshold
member.summary: Gets or Sets the threshold distance between any adjacent non-null data points which causes a gap in the line.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.NullDataGaps
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether line graphs will have gaps (broken lines) where null data is located. Null data is defined by the Data.NullDataValue and Data.NullDataValueX properties.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.BarWidth
member.summary: Gets and Sets the bar/candlestick width when Plot.Method is set to bar or specificplotmode. See also OhlcMinWidth and FixedSpmWidth.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.HiddenLinesInArea
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether dashed lines show hidden area plots behind other area plots.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SpecificPlotModeColor
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether the specific plot mode plotting methods will be drawn with multiple colors. The colors will be controlled via Color.SubsetColors. See Help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.MinimumPointSize
member.summary: This property enables and controls the size of the minimum point size. This property is helpful when using small charts and you want to maintain a minimum point size. Sizes are 2,4,6,8,10 pixels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.MaximumPointSize
member.summary: This property enables and controls the size of the maximum point size. This property is helpful when using large charts and you want to maintain a maximum point size. Sizes are 2,4,6,8,10 pixels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.MaxMarkerSize
member.summary: When using MarkDataPoints, this property controls the size of the maximum markert size. Default is enabled, So new v7 has smaller marker sizes for large charts.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.SortPlotMethods
member.summary: If Plot.Methods() is being used, then by default, plotting methods will automatically be sorted. Sorting results in plotting methods being drawn in this order: Area, Bar, OHLC, Point, and Line. Set this property to FALSE to disable sorting and draw plotting methods in the order of their subset index.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.FixedSpmWidth
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether width of OHLC and CandleStick graphics are independent of image size. Used when Plot.Method is set to SpecificPlotMode.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.OhlcMinWidth
member.summary: Gets and Sets the the minimum width of the open and close tick widths and candle-stick widths. Units are purely logical. Default is 16, range = 1 to 30.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.LineShadows
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether lines can include a drop-shadow effect if Plot.DataShadows is non-zero. ///

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphOptionsPlotItems.GradientBars
member.summary: Controls if Bars and CandleSticks include a gradient effect. Units are in pixels, the recommended setting is 8 pixels in which case bars at least 8 pixels wide will include gradient.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphOptionsPlotItems.FloatingStackedBars
member.summary: Setting this property to True and passing Data.Z for each point index will cause a stacked bar chart to float on-top of the provided Z data values.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphOptionsPlotItems.PointPadding
member.summary: This property controls the padding to the left and right of the first and last points when using a point or line plotting method. This property defines the padding in terms of percentage of space between data points. The valid range is from 0.0 to 2.0 for 0% to 200% of the space between data points. Set to zero to have lines and points plot directly next to left and right edges of grid. Default is 0.5

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphOptionsPlotItems.PointPaddingArea
member.summary: This property controls the padding to the left and right of the first and last points when using an area plotting method. This property defines the padding in terms of percentage of space between data points. The valid range is from 0.0 to 2.0 for 0% to 200% of the space between data points. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphOptionsPlotItems.PointPaddingBar
member.summary: This property controls the padding to the left and right of the first and last points when using a bar plotting method. This property defines the padding in terms of percentage of space between data points. The valid range is from 0.0 to 2.0 for 0% to 200% of the space between data points. Set to zero to have bars plot directly next to left and right edges of grid. Default is 0.5

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.FloatingStackedBars
member.summary: Setting this property to True and passing Data.Z for each point index will cause a stacked bar chart to float on-top of the provided Z data values.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.ContourLinesColored
member.summary: Set to True to cause the ContourLine plotting method to use SubsetColors for lines, else, line colors are equal to GraphForeColor.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.GraphDataLabels
member.summary: This property controls whether data labels are placed next to data points. The type of labels is defined by Plot.Options.AllowDataLabels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.AllowDataLabels
member.summary: Gets and Sets the type of data-point labels placed next to data-points. Depending upon setting, you may also need to set Strings.PointLabels, or Strings.DataPointLabels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.BubbleSize
member.summary: Gets and Sets the size of bubbles when Plot.Method is set to Bubble.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.BubbleGradientStyle
member.summary: Gets and Sets the gradient style of bubbles when Plot.Method is set to Bubble.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.BubbleSizeFormulaArea
member.summary: Controls how bubble sizes are determined. True=size bubbles based off area formula, False=size based off diameter.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.ContourLineLabelDensity
member.summary: This property controls the density of contour line labels. Possible values are 0 through 9 where 0 is the most dense and 9 is the least dense. Contour Line Labels are enabled Plot.Option.GraphDataLabels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphOptionsPlotItems.FloatingBars
member.summary: Setting this property to True and passing Data.Z for each point index will cause a bar chart to float on-top of the provided Z data values. Only one Z data value is needed per point index.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.GraphDataLabels
member.summary: This property controls whether data labels are placed next to data points. The type of labels is defined by Plot.Options.AllowDataLabels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.SurfacePolygonBorders
member.summary: This property controls whether polygons will show borders when Plot.PlottingMethod is set to Surface with Shading.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ZDistance
member.summary: Gets and Sets the viewing distance from the 3D image. This value can be tweaked by a few units if axis labels are being truncated. Default is -25.0.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.AddSkirts
member.summary: This property controls whether 3D surface plots will contain extra polygons forming sides to the surface. When Plot.PolyMode is set to PolygonData, if the polygon data forms an enclosed surface, this property should be set to TRUE.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.AllowDataLabels
member.summary: Gets and Sets the type of data-point labels placed next to data-points. Depending upon setting, you may also need to set Strings.PointLabels, or Strings.DataPointLabels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.NegativeFromXAxis
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether negative Bar, Area, and Stick plotting method graphics get drawn from the x axis or from bottom of chart.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ShadingStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the shading style of 3D polygons.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ShowContour
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether a 2D contour is included in image.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ShowBoundingBox
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether a 2D contour is included in image.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.RotationDetail
member.summary: Gets or Sets the amount of detail included in image while rotating.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ManualContourScaleControl
member.summary: Gets and Sets control of the range of the graph’s contour lines. Use ManualContourMin and ManualContourMax to define range. When using this property, it is likely you will also want to set Plot.Option.ManualContourLine.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ManualContourMin
member.summary: Gets and Sets the minimum contour range. Setting this value also depends on setting ManualContourScaleControl.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ManualContourMax
member.summary: Gets and Sets the maximum contour range. Setting this value also depends on setting ManualContourScaleControl.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.ManualContourLine
member.summary: Gets and Sets the density of contour lines/colors when Plot.Option.ShowContour is set to produce contours. If zero (default), then contour line density is automatically determined.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphOptionsPlotItems.DegreePrompting
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether user has ability of selecting the Pixel Surface plotting method within the customization dialog and popup menu.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphOptionsPlotItems.GraphDataLabels
member.summary: This property controls whether data labels are placed next to data points. The type of labels is defined by Plot.Options.AllowDataLabels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphOptionsPlotItems.AllowDataLabels
member.summary: Gets and Sets the type of data-point labels placed next to data-points. Depending upon setting, you may also need to set Strings.PointLabels, or Strings.DataPointLabels.

member.summary: Gets and Sets whether comparison subsets are plotted via Plot.Method or Plot.ComparisonMethod.

member.summary: Gets and Sets whether line graphs will have gaps (broken lines) where null data is located. Null data is defined by the Data.NullDataValue and Data.NullDataValueX properties.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphOptionsPlotItems.HiddenLinesInArea
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether dashed lines show hidden area plots behind other area plots.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphOptionsPlotItems.MinimumPointSize
member.summary: This property enables and controls the size of the minimum point size. This property is helpful when using small charts and you want to maintain a minimum point size. Sizes are 2,4,6,8,10 pixels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphOptionsPlotItems.MaximumPointSize
member.summary: This property enables and controls the size of the maximum point size. This property is helpful when using large charts and you want to maintain a maximum point size. Sizes are 2,4,6,8,10 pixels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphOptionsPlotItems.MaxMarkerSize

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.SubsetPointTypes
member.summary: Gets and Sets the point styles associated with zero based subset indices.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.SubsetLineTypes
member.summary: Gets and Sets the line styles associated with zero based subset indices.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.SubsetColors
member.summary: Gets and Sets the color associated with zero based subset indices.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.PointTypes
member.summary: Gets and Sets data point types on a per-point basis. To change point types per subset use Plot.SubsetPointTypes. To control per subset use of this property, set Plot.SubsetForPointTypes.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.PointColors
member.summary: Gets or Sets color on a per data point basis. To change point color per subset, use Plot.SubsetColors. If you use this property, you need to define color for all points unless Plot.SubsetForPointColors is used to designated which subsets use this property and which use the default Plot.SubsetColors property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.SubsetForPointTypes
member.summary: This property will determine which subset indices will use Plot.PointTypes and which will use the default type defined with the Plot.SubsetPointTypes property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.SubsetForPointColors
member.summary: This property will determine which subset indices will use Plot.PointColors and which will use the default color defined with the Plot.SubsetColors property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.PointSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets the point size when Plot.Method is set to include point graphics. See also, Plot.Option.MinimumPointSize

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PlotItems.ComparisonSubsets
member.summary: Gets and Sets the quantity of subsets at end of subset range to be plotted in a secondary plotting method. Used to mix plotting methods such as bars and lines. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.Option
member.summary: Properties providing general control over plotting method optional features.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.Allow

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.AutoStatSubsets
member.summary: Defines automatic statistical subsets to be appended to control. Use enumeration Enums.AutoStatSubsets.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.SubsetHatch
member.summary: Gets and Sets the hatch type associated with zero based subset indices. Hatching is possible with bars, areas, and pie chart slices. The color of hatch foreground is controlled with Color.SubsetColors. The hatch background color is controlled with Color.HatchBackColor.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.PointHatch
member.summary: Gets and Sets the hatch type associated with zero based subset and point index. Used to control hatching on a per Bar basis. The color of hatch foreground is controlled with Color.PointColors. The hatch background color is controlled with Color.HatchBackColor.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.Methods
member.summary: Gets and Sets the plotting style associated with zero based subset indices. Used to control plotting style on a per subset basis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.DataShadows
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether shadows or 3D effects are used on bars, points, and other graphics.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.SpecificPlotMode
member.summary: Gets or Sets the multi subset style (OpenHighLowClose, CandleStick, HighLowBar) when Plot.Method is set to SpecificPlotMode.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.MarkDataPoints
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether datapoints are annotated with a small dot.

member.summary: Gets and Sets the quantity of subsets at end of subset range to be plotted in a secondary plotting method with respect to right y axis. Used to mix plotting methods such as bars and lines. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphPlotItems.Method
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of chart, Line, Bar, Area, Point, etc.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the comparison style of chart, Line, Point, etc. produced from the use of ComparisonSubsets or RYAxisComparisonSubsets.

member.summary: Gets and Sets the plotting style associated with zero based subset indices. Used to control plotting style on a per subset basis.

member.summary: Properties controlling whether specific plotting methods will be available.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphPlotItems.Methods
member.summary: Gets and Sets the plotting style associated with zero based subset indices. Used to control plotting style on a per subset basis.

member.summary: Gets or Sets whether datapoints are annotated with a small dot.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphPlotItems.Method
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of chart. This property is dependent upon Plot.PolyMode. When Plot.PolyMode is SurfacePolygons ThreeDBar, or PolygonData, 0=WireFrame, 1=Surface, 2=Surface with Shading, 3=Surface with Pixels, 4=Surface with Contours. When Plot.PolyMode is Scatter, 0=Points, 1=Lines, 2=Points + Lines.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphPlotItems.MethodII
member.summary: Gets or Sets the comparison style of chart, Line, Point, etc. produced from the use of Plot.ComparisonSubsets.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphPlotItems.PolyMode
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of polygon contruction. Depending upon this setting, Plot.Method has different possibilities.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphPlotItems.DegreeOfRotation
member.summary: Gets or Sets the current horizontal scroll bar position (0 - 359 degrees) controlling horizontal image rotation. NOTE: Only set this property after the control is initialized via one of the Functions.Reinitialize.. functions.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphPlotItems.ViewingHeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets the current vertical scroll bar position controlling vertical image rotation. Possible values range from 50 through –50. Where 50 is looking above 3d image. NOTE: Only set this property after the control is initialized via one of the Functions.Reinitialize.. functions.

member.summary: Properties providing general control over plotting method optional features.

member.summary: Gets or Sets whether datapoints are annotated with a small dot.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of chart, Line, Point, etc.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the comparison style of chart, Line, Point, etc. produced from the use of Plot.ComparisonSubsets.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphPlotItems.SmithChart
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of polygon contruction. Depending upon this setting, Plot.Method has different possibilities.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphPlotItems.RYAxisComparisonSubsets
member.summary: Gets and Sets the quantity of subsets at end of subset range to be plotted in a secondary plotting method with respect to a secondary y axis. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PSGraphPlotItems.DataShadows
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether shadows or 3D effects are used on bars, points, and other graphics.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.GradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of pie gradient. RenderEngine must be GdiPlus to enable.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.SubsetColors
member.summary: Gets and Sets the color associated with zero based subset indices.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.SubsetHatch
member.summary: Gets and Sets the hatch type associated with zero based subset indices. Hatching is possible with bars, areas, and pie chart slices. The color of hatch foreground is controlled with Color.SubsetColors. The hatch background color is controlled with Color.HatchBackColor.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.DataShadows
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether shadows or 3D effects are included in data based graphics.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.DataLabelType
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether the Pie Chart Object displays slice labels as percentages or actual values.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.GroupingPercent
member.summary: Gets or Sets the size of Pie Chart slices that get grouped into the *Other slice. The *Other slice is used to make the graph more readable by pooling all the small sliver type pie slices into one larger pie slice.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.ShowPieLabels
member.summary: Gets or Sets the style of pie slice label, Percent or Value.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.SliceHatching
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether hatching is only for monochrome images or both monochrome and color images.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.SliceStartLocation
member.summary: Gets or Sets the location of first slice. Values range from 0 to 360. For Example: To rotate clockwise 30 more degrees set this property to 125 or (default value 95) + 30 = 125.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.Show3DShadow
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether 3D Pie Charts will also have a drop shadow.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.DropShadowOffsetX
member.summary: This property controls the horizontal offset of drop shadow. Units are logical, 50 = 50/5000 = 1/100th of width of image. Valid values range from –500 to 500. Refer to example 303 in demo.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.DropShadowOffsetY
member.summary: This property controls the vertical offset of drop shadow. Units are logical, 50 = 50/5000 = 1/100th of height of image. Valid values range from –500 to 500. Refer to example 303 in demo.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.DropShadowSteps
member.summary: This property controls the number of fountain steps used to produce drop shadow. Values 0 through 10, and values 20, 30, 40 ,50, 60 , and 70 provide different drop shadow widths and effects. Refer to example 303 in demo.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.DropShadowWidth
member.summary: This property controls the size of drop shadow. Units are logical, 200 = 200/5000 = 1/25th image size. Recommended values are from 0 to 500. Refer to example 303 in demo.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.ManualSliceLabelLength
member.summary: Set to a number of characters which is larger than any slice label within this and other charts. Use this property to get multiple pie charts with the same radius.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCPlotItems.ManualRadius
member.summary: Gets or Sets a manual radius width. This is useful when you have multiple pies on the same form and need a consistent radius among all pies. This property sets the radius as a percentage of control width. For example, if the control is 1000 pixels wide and this property is set to 20, then the pie's radius will be 200 pixels. The default value of zero disables this feature and the radius is a function of PieLabel lengths and positions.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.PrepareImages
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether image is prepared in memory and bit blitted to screen for smooth drawing.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.CacheBmp
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether image prepared in memory via Configure.PrepareImages is retained in memory allowing faster redraws.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.ImageAdjustLeft
member.summary: This property adds or removes space from the left of the graph. Units are logical and are 1/100th of the size of the y axis width. For example, a value of 100 adds the distance equal to the y axis label width, 200 adds twice the distance of the y axis label width.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.ImageAdjustRight
member.summary: This property adds or removes space from the right of the graph. Units are logical and are 1/100th of the size of the y axis width. For example, a value of 100 adds the distance equal to the y axis label width, 200 adds twice the distance of the y axis label width.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.ImageAdjustTop
member.summary: This property adds or removes space from the top of the graph. Units are logical and are 1/100th of the size of the x axis height. For example, a value of 100 adds the distance equal to the x axis label height, 200 adds twice the distance of the x axis label height.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.ImageAdjustBottom
member.summary: This property adds or removes space from the bottom of the graph. Units are logical and are 1/100th of the size of the x axis height. For example, a value of 100 adds the distance equal to the x axis label height, 200 adds twice the distance of the x axis label height.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.BorderTypes
member.summary: Gets and Sets the border style for graph and table bounding boxes.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.TextShadows
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether text will include a drop-shadow effect.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.DarkTextInset
member.summary: If false, dark text is never shadowed. If true, dark text is drawn with a 3D inset effect rather than shadowed.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.RenderEngine
member.summary: Gets and Sets which rendering logic is invoked. GDI is faster but does not support anti-aliasing or alphablending. Hybrid mode can AntiAlias only Text.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.AntiAliasText
member.summary: If true, anti-alias text. Only valid if RenderingEngine = Hybrid or GdiPlus.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Gets and Sets the algorithm used in anti aliasing text.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.AntiAliasGraphics
member.summary: If true, anti-alias graphics (lines, symbols, polygons). Only valid if RenderingEngine = GdiPlus.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ConfigureItems.DataShadowsTranslucent
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether shadows are translucent when RenderEngine is set to GdiPlus.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.PCConfigureItems.ManualSliceLabelLength
member.summary: Set to a number of characters which is larger than any slice label within this and other charts. Use this property to get multiple pie charts with the same radius.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.HObject
member.summary: Read Only, Gets the internal handle of the ProEssentials object. Used as the first argument to ProEssentials DLL calls such as PEvset.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.ObjectType
member.summary: Read Only, Gets the internal type (Graph, SGraph, Polar, Pie, 3D) of the ProEssentials object.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.AnisotropicSupport
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether image is produced via the MM_ANISOTROPIC mapping mode. Probably never needed within .NET but who knows. We added for ActiveXs to work within Access reports.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.Custom
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether image is constructed with custom or original parameter set. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.CustomParms
member.summary: Gets whether control supports a custom and original parameter set. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.Painting
member.summary: Gets whether control is in the process of painting image to screen.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.HelpFileName
member.summary: Gets or Sets the help file name invoked from built-in menus and dialogs.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.DataHotSpotLimit
member.summary: Gets or Sets the maximum number of hot spots possible.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.PixelSizingThreshold
member.summary: Default = 3300, represents likely max monitor size, triggers different logic if size of image is larger than this threshold, it assumes image is very high resolution.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.LogicalLimit
member.summary: When exporting metafiles from an object that has been zoomed, lines may be drawn outside the metafile’s region. Setting this property to zero will prevent this from happening.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.Delimiter
member.summary: Default value is '|' or char 124, the pipe symbol. You'll only need to adjust if you need to use some other character as a delimiter. ProEssentials uses this delimeter in various features. Titles use delimiter to separate into left,centered, and right justified portions. Annotation Text use delimeters to define justification codes.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.Stop
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether image construction should be halted. Generally set this property from a secondary thread so the primary thread stops the image construction process.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.AutoImageReset
member.summary: This property controls whether ProEssentials will automatically call Function.Reinitialize if properties were adjusted and then an image is requested. This property should only be disabled in certain real-time implementation. This allows new data to be set without having to reinitialize the object.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.DpiX
member.summary: Gets or Sets the target Dots-Per-Inch DPI width for exported metafiles. When using the FixedFonts feature, it is recommended to set this property to 600 if export could possibly be printed, or 96 if the export will only be viewed on a monitor.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.DpiY
member.summary: Gets or Sets the target Dots-Per-Inch DPI height for exported metafiles. When using the FixedFonts feature, it is recommended to set this property to 600 if export could possibly be printed, or 96 if the export will only be viewed on a monitor.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SpecialItems.UsingUiSourceCode
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether ui souce code is being used.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphSpecialItems.ThreeDThreshold
member.summary: If the number of points in an image is beyond the threshold defined by this property, then 3D bar and 3D area graphs will be drawn in 2D. This prevents overly complex images from being generated.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphSpecialItems.AppendWithNoUpdate
member.summary: For Real-Time implementation only. Normally calling PEvset with property PEP_faAPPENDYDATA will cause the image to be automatically updated. Setting this property to TRUE will disable the automatic update and the programmer will have to explicitly call PEreinitialize, PEresetimage and InvalidateRect.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphSpecialItems.BestFitFix
member.summary: This property controls a change in the Least-Square Approximation calculation. When set to TRUE, the minimum x value is first subtracted from each x data value before processed. This improves accuracy when XData is very large. This does not effect the chart visually, but will alter the coefficients retrieved from PEP_faBESTFITCOEFFS.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphSpecialItems.ThreeDThreshold
member.summary: If the number of points in an image is beyond the threshold defined by this property, then 3D bar and 3D area graphs will be drawn in 2D. This prevents overly complex images from being generated.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphSpecialItems.BestFitFix
member.summary: This property controls a change in the Least-Square Approximation calculation. When set to TRUE, the minimum x value is first subtracted from each x data value before processed. This improves accuracy when XData is very large. This does not effect the chart visually, but will alter the coefficients retrieved from PEP_faBESTFITCOEFFS.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.AnnotationItems.InFrontOfGrid
member.summary: This property controls if annotations are drawn in-front (true) or behind (false) any grid lines.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.AnnotationItems.ShowAllTableAnnotations
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether all table annotations are visible.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.AnnotationItems.Show
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether Graph, Line, and Axis annotations are visible.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.AnnotationItems.InFront
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether annotations are plotted in front of plotting methods or behind.

member.name: M:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.GetRectTA
member.summary: Called to get pixel coordinates of the table annotation bounding box. Establish PeAnnotation.Table.Working before retrieving this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.GradientColor
member.summary: Gets or Sets gradient starting color if GradientStyle non zero. Default is White and usually not needing adjusting. Useful to produce darker charts.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.GradientStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets background gradient style. Set with items from Enums.PlotGradientStyle

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.BevelStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets background bevel style. Set with items from Enums.BevelStyle

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.GradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets or sets background gradient boundary. Set with items from Enums.GradientBoundary

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.BevelLighting
member.summary: Gets or sets background bevel lighting. Set with items from Enums.BevelLighting

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Type
member.summary: Gets and Sets the table annotation cell types. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.HotSpot
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether individual table annotation cells are clickable. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.ColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets and Sets manual width of table column. By default column widths are automatically configured. If you set this property, it defines a new minimum column width. Units are in number-of-characters. Always establish Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Justification
member.summary: Gets and Sets the style of justification for individual cell text. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Text
member.summary: Gets and Sets the text for individual cells. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Fonts
member.summary: Gets and Sets the font name for individual cells. The font for the entire table can be set with Annotation.Table.Font. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Color
member.summary: Gets and Sets the foreground color for individual cells. The foreground color for the entire table can be set with Annotation.Table.ForeColor. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Working
member.summary: Gets and Sets the working table index 0 through 19. Used when you need to work with multiple table annotations. Set before adjusting any additional table annotation properties.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Rows
member.summary: Gets and Sets the quantity of rows for the table annotation. Set this property and Annotation.Table.Columns before passing table annotation text.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Columns
member.summary: Gets and Sets the quantity of columns for the table annotation. Set this property and Annotation.Table.Rows before passing table annotation text.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.HeaderRows
member.summary: Gets and Sets the quantity of header rows for the table annotation. Header rows stand apart from the rest of the grid by their placement outside/above the table annotation bounding box.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.HeaderColumn
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether the table annotation will have a header column. The header column stands apart from the rest of the grid by their placement outside/left the table annotation bounding box.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.HeaderOrientation
member.summary: Gets or Gets the orientation of the header rows if Annotation.Table.HeaderRows is non-zero.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Location
member.summary: Gets or Sets the table annotation location.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Border
member.summary: Gets or Sets the border style of the table annotation's bounding box.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or Sets color used as the background color for the table annotation's bounding box.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or Sets color used as the foreground color for the table annotation's text.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.TextSize
member.summary: Gets and Sets the text size for the table annotation. Default value 100 produces text that is the same size as other label text. Valid values range from 20 to 200.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Show
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether the table annotation is visible.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Font
member.summary: Gets or Sets font name used for the table annotation. Individual cell font control can be implemented with Annotation.Table.Fonts().

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.ShowAll
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether all table annotations are visible.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.FontSizeFixed
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether font sizes are fixed for the table annotation. Set to TRUE to disable any potential text-to-fit logic.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Bold
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether individual table annotation cells are bold. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Italic
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether individual table annotation cells are italic. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Underline
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether individual table annotation cells are underlined. Always establish Table.Rows and Table.Columns before setting this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.X
member.summary: Gets and Sets the pixel location of table annotation when PeAnnotation.Table.Location = InsidePixelUnits.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Y
member.summary: Gets and Sets the pixel location of table annotation when PeAnnotation.Table.Location = InsidePixelUnits.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Width
member.summary: Gets and Sets the width in pixels of table annotation when PeAnnotation.Table.Location = InsidePixelUnits.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.TextMode
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether the table annotation will be used in TextMode to render a paragraph of text. Rows and Columns must both be set to 1 when using this feature.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.TableAnnotationItems.Moveable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the table is moveable by the user when PeAnnotation.Table.Location is set to InsidePixelUnits.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphTableAnnotationItems.Location
member.summary: Gets or Sets the table annotation location. If location set is located within an axis, further define location with Annotation.Table.AxisLocation.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphTableAnnotationItems.AxisLocation
member.summary: If Annotation.Table.Location is set to a location within an axis, this property controls table location within the axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphTableAnnotationItems.Location
member.summary: Gets or Sets the table annotation location. If location set is located within an axis, further define location with Annotation.Table.AxisLocation.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphTableAnnotationItems.AxisLocation
member.summary: If Annotation.Table.Location is set to a location within an axis, this property controls table location within the axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphAnnotation.Y
member.summary: Y Value used to locate annotation.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphAnnotation.X
member.summary: X Value used to locate annotation.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.MinSymbolSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets a potential minimum size for annotation symbols. Sizes are 2,4,6,8,10 pixels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.MaxSymbolSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets a potential maximum size for annotation symbols. Sizes are 2,4,6,8,10 pixels.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.TextSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets the size of graph annotation text. Values range from 25 to 300. 100 represents same size as grid numbers, 25 is quarter size, and 300 is 3 times the size.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Show
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether graph annotations are shown at all times or controlled via the Annotations.Show property which controls all annotations.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.HotSpot
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether an individual graph annotation is a hot spot. See also: UI.HotSpot.GraphAnnotation.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.SubsetObstacles
member.summary: Set a particular subset index to True to designate that subset as an obstacle in conjunction with graph annotation text dodging logic. For example, for a line chart, graph annotation text will dodge the line if the line’s subset index is set to True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Type
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation types. Set with ProEssentials.Enums.GraphAnnotationType.

member.summary: Gets and Sets whether graph annotation shadows are shown.

member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation position. Set with ProEssentials.Enums.AnnotationInFront.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.X
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation x axis value.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Y
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation y axis value.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.ZoomWindow
member.summary: Gets and Sets potential zoom window location. Set using ProEssentials.Enums.AnnotationZoomWindow.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Text
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation text value.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Color
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation color.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Axis
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation axis (0 through 16) where annotation is located.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.GradientColor
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation gradient start color. Default is White and usually not needing adjusting. Useful to produce darker charts.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.GradientStyle
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation gradient styles. Set with items from Enums.PlotGradientStyle

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.BevelStyle
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation bevel styles. Set with items from Enums.BevelStyle

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.GradientBoundary
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation gradient boundary. Set with items from Enums.GradientBoundary

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.BevelLighting
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation bevel lighting. Set with items from Enums.BevelLighting

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.TextLocation
member.summary: This property array tests the included angles (in the respective order) while attempting to find a location void of annotation text. Logic searches all angles and then increases test radius by 15% and rechecks all angles. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.TriangleAnnotationAdj
member.summary: This property controls how triangle annotations are located. If True, triangles are located so their vertex is at the Annotation.Graph.Y value. This allows up-triangle and down-triangle annotations to work as pointers and point to the location defined by the Annotation.Graph.Y value. If False, symbols are centered at the Annotation.Graph.Y location.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.HideIntersectingText
member.summary: Gets or Sets how intersecting graph annotation text is optionally handled. This property is used in conjuction with PeAnnotation.Graph.Type = Pointer(37). This features defaults to NoHiding and text will potentially move to prevent overlapping. Generally set to true when you have many annotations along a line. As the chart is zoomed/expanded, hidden text will become visible.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.SizeCntl
member.summary: This property allows developer to tweak the size of all graph annotation symbols. For example, set to .8 to make annotations smaller, set to 1.5 to make annotations larger.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.TextDodge
member.summary: Controls quantity of iterations through angles defined by Annotation.Graph.TextLocation while searching for an area void of graph annotation text. The logic searches all angles and then increases the test radius by 15% and rechecks all angles. Adjusting allows control over how long the pointer line can grow before abandoning the attempt to find empty space. Valid property range is from 0 to 100. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Moveable
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether Pointer(37) annotation types will be moveable if they are hot spots and user clicks and drags pointer text.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or Sets text background color for all graph annotation text. Set to a value of Color.Empty for a transparent background.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Bold
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether an individual graph annotation's text is bold. Once any index is set for Bold, Italic, Underline, Font, or FontSize, then alternate (slightly slower) logic is used to draw graph annotations.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Italic
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether an individual graph annotation's text is italic. Once any index is set for Bold, Italic, Underline, Font, or FontSize, then alternate (slightly slower) logic is used to draw graph annotations.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Underline
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether an individual graph annotation's text is underline. Once any index is set for Bold, Italic, Underline, Font, or FontSize, then alternate (slightly slower) logic is used to draw graph annotations.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.Font
member.summary: Gets and Sets graph annotation text font. Once any index is set for Font, FontSize, Bold, Italic, or Underline, then alternate (slightly slower) logic is used to draw graph annotations.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphGraphAnnotationItems.FontSize
member.summary: Gets and Sets relative graph annotation text size for an annotation. Common ranges are from .5 to 2.0. Once any index is set for Font, FontSize, Bold, Italic, or Underline, then alternate (slightly slower) logic is used to draw graph annotations.

member.summary: Gets or Sets how intersecting graph annotation text is optionally handled. This property is generally used in conjuction with Annotation.Graph.Type = Pointer(37). This features defaults to NoHiding and text will potentially move to prevent overlapping. If this property is set, then text may potentially be hidden in instances where overlapping would occur. As the chart is zoomed/expanded, hidden text will become visible.

member.summary: Y Value used to locate annotation within a Y axis.

member.summary: Y Value used to locate annotation within a Y axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.LineAnnotBackColor
member.summary: Gets or Sets the background color of line annotation text that uses 'S' (right side opaque justification code) or 'M' (left side opaque).

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.TextSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets the size of line annotation text. Values range from 25 to 300. 100 represents same size as grid numbers, 25 is quarter size, and 300 is 3 times the size.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.ShowMargins
member.summary: Controls when margin properties (LeftMargin, TopMargin, RightMargin, BottomMargin) are used, only when ShowAnnotations = True, Always, or Never.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.LeftMargin
member.summary: Gets or Sets a string whose length is used to allocate space left of y axis. Mostly used with horizontal line annotation text using |L justification code. Set this property to the longest annotation string placed on the outside left edge of graph.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.RightMargin
member.summary: Gets or Sets a string whose length is used to allocate space right of y axis. Mostly used with horizontal line annotation text using |R justification code. Set this property to the longest annotation string placed on the outside right edge of graph.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.TopMargin
member.summary: Gets or Sets a string whose length is used to allocate space above chart's grid. Mostly used with vertical line annotation text using |T justification code. Set this property to the longest annotation string placed on the outside top edge of graph.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphLineAnnotationItems.BottomMargin
member.summary: Gets or Sets a string whose length is used to allocate space below x axis. Mostly used with vertical line annotation text using |B justification code. Set this property to the longest annotation string placed on the outside bottom edge of graph.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.Pedo
member.summary: The Pedo WebForm control is used server side to transfer/append data client side. Our WinForms include an interface to read this data. Read after calling the AppendFromURL function.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.FilterOn
member.summary: Read only. True if image is a product of data reduction. PeData.Filter2D or PeData.Filter3D and Subsets/Points and size of chart all effect if FilterOn is True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.Subsets
member.summary: Always set this property prior to passing Data.Y and/or Data.X. Gets or Sets quantity of data series. Example: for a line chart, this is the number of lines with different colors.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.Points
member.summary: Always set this property prior to passing Data.Y and/or Data.X. Gets or Sets quantity of data points per series. Example: for a line chart, this is the number of data points per line.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.SubsetByPoint
member.summary: Gets and Sets how two dimensional property arrays (example, Data.Y, Data.X) are stored internally. If you will be adjusting the number of Subsets and/or Points and want to preserve existing data, read the help on this property.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.Precision
member.summary: Set or Get the precision used within table, on-screen coordinate prompting and data exporting.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.Y
member.summary: You must set Data.Subsets and Data.Points before passing this data. Gets or Sets single precision data plotted with respect to y axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.DataItems.X
member.summary: You must set Data.Subsets and Data.Points before passing this data. Gets or Sets single precision data plotted with respect to x axis. PieChart (Pepco) uses this for controlling slice size. Pego only uses x data for Date-Time handling.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.Filter2D
member.summary: Gets and Sets data reduction strength. Default=Quality. Setting to fastest setting could possibly degrade for scatter type charts.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.Z
member.summary: You must set Data.Subsets and Data.Points before passing this data. Gets or Sets single precision data used with floating bar charts.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.AutoScaleData
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether large/small data will be displayed with a scale factor. For example, a grid line value of 10,000,000 may be displayed as 10M if this property is true. M representing millions.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.Yii
member.summary: You must set Data.UsingYDataII=true, Data.Subsets and Data.Points before pass this data. Gets or Sets double precision data plotted with respect to y axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.Xii
member.summary: You must set Data.UsingXDataII=true, Data.Subsets and Data.Points before pass this data. Gets or Sets double precision data plotted with respect to x axis. Pego object only uses xdata for DateTime handling.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.RandomSubsetsToGraph
member.summary: Gets or Sets subsets to be included in image. Fill this array with zero based subset indices of those subsets you wish to include in the image.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.RandomPointsToGraph
member.summary: Gets or Sets points to be included in image. Fill this array with zero based point indices of those points you wish to include in the image.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.ScaleForYData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the Y Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.ScaleForRYData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the Right Y Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.NullDataValue
member.summary: Gets and Sets the YData value considered null and subsequently ignored.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.AppendToEnd
member.summary: Only used in a Real-Time implementation. Gets or Sets whether data is appended to end or beginning of memory. See also: PEP_faAPPENDYDATA.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.UsingYDataii
member.summary: If setting this property, set it before passing data. Gets and Sets whether single or double precision data is utilized. Set to true to use double precision (Data.Yii) instead of (Data.Y).

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.UsingXDataii
member.summary: If setting this property, set it before passing data. Gets and Sets whether single or double precision data is utilized. Set to true to use double precision (Data.Xii) instead of (Data.X).

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.BaseGraphDataItems.SubsetsToShow
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether subsets will be included in image. Similar to RandomSubsetsToGraph, this is a newer property array that makes it easier to select which subsets are visible. It also has an optional ability to control the order of how subsets are drawn. Example 033 in the demo shows the use of this new feature. When using this feature, you define a value of 0 to 9 for each subset. The subsets are then plotted with largest valued subsets first and any values of zero are skipped.

member.name: M:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.BindPointLabelPlusYData(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Loads PointLabels from first column and loads multiple subsets in remaining columns. Since this method loads all subset data, source must be a multi-column source such as a DataReader or DataView. This method will set Data.SubsetByPoint, Data.Subsets and Data.Points, clear existing data, and copy data from source. For a DataReader, SubsetByPoint will be set to false, else, SubsetByPoint is set to true.

member.name: M:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.BindYData(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Loads YData for multiple subsets in the order of their columns. Since this method loads all subset data, source must be a multi-column source such as a DataReader or DataView. This method will set Data.SubsetByPoint, Data.Subsets and Data.Points, clear existing data, and copy data from source. For a DataReader, SubsetByPoint will be set to false, else, SubsetByPoint is set to true.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.SequentialDataX
member.summary: Gets and Sets if data can potentially be optimized. Pego data is always seqential but this setting can be used to disable filtering.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.PointLabels
member.summary: Gets or Sets strings used to identify points.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.DateTimeMode
member.summary: This property enables DateTimeMode. This mode treats X axis data as serially formatted date/time data. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.DeltaX
member.summary: Used with Data.DateTimeMode = true. This property defines the distance in time between each data point. DeltaX greater than 0 for time in minutes. DeltaX = –1 for daily data, DeltaX = –2 for weekly data, DeltaX = –3 for monthly data.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.DeltasPerDay
member.summary: Used with Data.DateTimeMode = true. This property defines the number of data points per day. If Data.DeltaX is less than zero than this property is not used. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.StartTime
member.summary: This property sets the starting date and daily start time when used in conjunction with Data.DateTimeMode, Data.AutoXData, Data.DeltaX, and Data.DeltasPerDay. It is important that this value include the date value along with time.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.AutoXData
member.summary: Used with Data.DateTimeMode = true. This property controls whether ProEssentials includes Saturdays and Sundays in automatically generated Data.X or Data.Xii.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.DateTimeShowSeconds
member.summary: If Data.DateTimeMode is True, and data is exported via export dialog, this property controls whether seconds are included in time export.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.GraphDataItems.SpeedBoost
member.summary: Gets and Sets speedboost value. Default is 3. Valid range is 1 to 100 but best results are produced with values less than 30. This feature will attempt to reduce GDI LineTo calls by eliminating calls where the line only moves slightly from its previous position.

member.name: M:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.BindXandYData(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Loads both XData and YData for multiple subsets. The source must have two columns per subset. XData is loaded from the first set of columns and YData is loaded from the remaining columns. For example, if your chart has 4 subsets, then the data source must have 8 columns/fields. The first 4 columns set XData, and last 4 columns set YData. This method will set Data.SubsetByPoint, Data.Subsets and Data.Points, clear existing data, and copy data from source. For a DataReader, SubsetByPoint will be set to false, else, SubsetByPoint is set to true.

member.name: M:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.BindYData(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Loads YData for multiple subsets in the order of their columns. Since this method loads all subset data, source must be a multi-column source such as a DataReader or DataView. This method will set Data.SubsetByPoint, Data.Subsets and Data.Points, clear existing data, and copy data from source. For a DataReader, SubsetByPoint will be set to false, else, SubsetByPoint is set to true.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.SequentialDataX
member.summary: Gets and Sets if data can potentially be optimized. Default=Auto. This setting can be used to disable or force filtering.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.SequentialDataY
member.summary: Gets and Sets if data can potentially be optimized. Default=Auto. Pesgo generally only uses sequential y data in contour optimization. This setting can be used to disable or force filtering.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.DateTimeMode
member.summary: This property enables DateTimeMode. This mode treats X axis data as serially formatted date/time data. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.StartTime
member.summary: This property sets the daily start time when used in conjunction with Data.SpecialDateTimeMode, Data.EndTime, and Data.DateTimeMode.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.EndTime
member.summary: This property sets the daily end time when used in conjunction with Data.SpecialDateTimeMode, Data.StartTime, and Data.DateTimeMode.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.DateTimeShowSeconds
member.summary: If Data.DateTimeMode is True, and data is exported via export dialog, this property controls whether seconds are included in time export.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.DateTimeMilliSeconds
member.summary: If Data.DateTimeMode is True, and data is exported via export dialog, this property controls whether milliseconds are included in time export.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.SpeedBoost
member.summary: Gets and Sets speedboost value. Default is 3. Valid range is 1 to 100 but best results are produced with values less than 30. This feature will attempt to reduce GDI LineTo calls by eliminating calls where the line only moves slightly from its previous position.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.ScaleForXData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the bottom X Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.ScaleForTXData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the top X Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.SpecialDateTimeMode
member.summary: SpecialDateTime mode produces a date/time x axis scale which only shows time between Data.StartTime and Data.EndTime. This produces a discontinuous x axis scale. This mode is only valid for time spans which are limited to include one weekend. Date.DateTimeMode must also be set to True. See help for more info.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.NullDataValueX
member.summary: Gets and Sets the X Data value considered null and subsequently ignored.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.SGraphDataItems.NullDataValueZ
member.summary: Gets and Sets the Z Data value considered null and subsequently ignored.

member.name: M:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.BindXYandZData(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Loads XData, YData and ZData for multiple subsets. The source must have three columns per subset. XData is loaded from the first set of columns, YData is loaded from the second set of columns, and ZData loaded from the remaining columns. For example, if your chart has 4 subsets, then the data source must have 12 columns/fields. The first 4 columns set XData, the next 4 columns set YData, and last 4 columns set ZData. This method will set Data.SubsetByPoint, Data.Subsets and Data.Points, clear existing data, and copy data from source. For a DataReader, SubsetByPoint will be set to false, else, SubsetByPoint is set to true.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.SequentialDataX
member.summary: Gets and Sets if data can potentially be optimized. Default=Auto. This setting can be used to disable or force filtering. Pe3do uses SequentialDataX optimization for only scatter and waterfall plots. Filter3D effects surfaces and wireframes.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.Filter3D
member.summary: Reduce data for any dimension if dimension quantity exceeds this threshold. For example, if Subsets=200 and Filter3D default=150, data will be optimuzed as if Subsets=150.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.Z
member.summary: You must set Data.Subsets and Data.Points before passing this data. Gets or Sets single precision data.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.Zii
member.summary: You must set Data.Subsets and Data.Points before passing this data. Gets or Sets double precision data.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.SurfaceNullDataGaps
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether surface plots will process null data values to produce gaps in the surface.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.AutoScaleData
member.summary: Gets and Sets whether large/small data will be displayed with a scale factor. For example, a grid line value of 10,000,000 may be displayed as 10M if this property is true. M representing millions.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.Yii
member.summary: You must set Data.UsingYDataII=true, Data.Subsets and Data.Points before pass this data. Gets or Sets double precision data plotted with respect to y axis.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.Xii
member.summary: You must set Data.UsingXDataII=true, Data.Subsets and Data.Points before pass this data. Gets or Sets double precision data plotted with respect to x axis. Pego object only uses xdata for DateTime handling.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.ScaleForYData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the Y Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.ScaleForXData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the X Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.ScaleForZData
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor as a power of 10 for the Z Axis. Only used if Data.AutoScaleData = True.

member.summary: Gets and Sets the YData value considered null and subsequently ignored.

member.summary: Gets and Sets the XData value considered null and subsequently ignored.

member.name: P:Gigasoft.ProEssentials.ThreeDGraphDataItems.NullDataValueZ
member.summary: Gets and Sets the ZData value considered null and subsequently ignored.
